etymologies: late 18th century (designating church music in plainsong mode): from medieval Latin tonalis, from Latin tonus (see tone)

definitions: relating to the tone of music, color, or writing
shortDefinitions: of tone of music or writing

definitions: relating to music written using conventional keys and harmony.
shortDefinitions: of music written using conventional keys and harmony

definitions: (of a language) expressing semantic differences by varying the intonation given to words or syllables of a similar sound.
shortDefinitions: (of language) expressing semantic differences by varying intonation given to words or syllables of similar sound
